metadata.title: Indonesia Tax Amnesty & Voluntary Disclosure Programs

pps2022.name: Program Pengungkapan Sukarela (Voluntary Disclosure Program)
pps2022.description: Opportunity for taxpayers to voluntarily disclose previously unreported assets and income with reduced tax rates

policy1.name: Kebijakan I
policy1.description: For Tax Amnesty 2016 participants who did not fully disclose

policy2.name: Kebijakan II
policy2.description: For individual taxpayers with undisclosed assets
policy2.condition: Not disclosed in 2020 Annual Tax Return

repatriated.condition: Assets repatriated to Indonesia OR invested in SBN/renewable energy/downstream industries
Assets repatriated OR invested in SBN/renewable energy/downstream industries

benefits.noAudit: No tax audit for disclosed assets
benefits.noCriminal: No criminal prosecution for tax evasion on disclosed assets
benefits.noPenalty: No administrative penalties on disclosed amounts
benefits.finalTax: PPh rate is final (no further income tax)
benefits.cleanSlate: Start fresh with compliant tax status

example.scenario: Individual with undisclosed offshore assets IDR 10B (acquired 2018)

taxAmnesty2016.name: Tax Amnesty Program 2016-2017
taxAmnesty2016.legacy: Largest tax amnesty in Indonesian history, PPS 2022 was for those who missed it

voluntaryDisclosure.name: Voluntary Disclosure (Outside Amnesty Period)
voluntaryDisclosure.description: Disclose unreported income/assets voluntarily before audit

benefits.cooperationCredit: Show good faith to tax office

process: Prepare disclosure letter (Surat Pernyataan Pengungkapan Harta)
Submit to tax office with payment
Amend previous tax returns if needed

sunsetPolicy.name: Sunset Policy
sunsetPolicy.description: Periodic forgiveness of past tax violations

futurePrograms.speculation: Indonesia may introduce new amnesty programs periodically
futurePrograms.recommendation: Monitor DJP announcements, act quickly if new program announced

unreportedAssets: PPS 2022 closed - missed opportunity for 6-18% rates
Alternative: Wait for next amnesty (unpredictable timing)
Recommendation: Disclose voluntarily if asset value significant
Example: IDR 5B undisclosed â†’ Voluntary 15% = IDR 750M vs Audit penalty IDR 7.5B+ (tax + 50% + interest + criminal)
foreignAccounts: CRS (Common Reporting Standard) active - Indonesia receives foreign account data
FATCA - US accounts reported to Indonesia
Voluntary disclosure before DJP discovers = better outcome
repatriation: If new amnesty announced: Repatriate for lowest rate
Investment options: Government bonds (SBN), renewable energy, downstream industries
Benefit: Lowest tax rate + contribute to Indonesian economy

taxPlanning: Report all foreign accounts in annual return

offshoreInvestments.problem: Indonesian with Singapore/Hong Kong investments not reported
offshoreInvestments.alternative: Wait for next amnesty (risky - CRS may report first)

propertyAbroad.problem: Villa in Bali owned via nominee (illegal structure)
propertyAbroad.solution: Restructure to legal PT PMA + voluntary disclosure of past income
propertyAbroad.cost: 15% + restructuring cost vs 100% loss if caught (nominee illegal)

businessIncome.problem: Cash revenue not reported for years

quickReference.crsActive: Yes - foreign accounts reported to Indonesia
quickReference.recommendation: Disclose voluntarily if significant unreported assets
